article.author: Zach Cartwright
article.mainText: Copious amounts of alcohol will likely be consumed as anticipation over tonight’s presidential debate reaches a boiling point. Some Twitter users have found a creative way to express both their excitement and their frustration at watching Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump take the debate stage at Hofstra University tonight. While some have suggested playing drinking games in which the viewer takes a sip of an alcoholic beverage whenever Hillary Clinton refers to becoming the first woman president or when Trump mentions building a wall, some have taken the concept of a drinking game for the first televised conversation between the two candidates to a new level: DEBATE DRINKING GAME RULES: When the debate starts, do a bunch of PCP — Ian Boudreau (@iboudreau) September 26, 2016 The loser of tonight's debate will be my liver — Erin Gloria Ryan (@morninggloria) September 26, 2016 Others have lamented on how the media will likely “grade Trump on a curve,” meaning he will be held to a much lower standard than Hillary Clinton. Others remarked on the GOP nominee’s “unconventional” preparation, and how Hillary Clinton is likely preparing herself for Trump’s barbs. TRUMP: I did a doodie in my diapie. Sad! HILLARY: [not smiling enough, or whatever] CABLE NEWS: Trump wins in a rout. Astonishing — Patrick Monahan (@pattymo) September 26, 2016 [presidential debate] TRUMP: i propose we kill everyone HILLARY: do u want a president who says he'll kill everyone TRUMP: i never said that — Bob Vulfov (@bobvulfov) September 19, 2016 TRUMP GOALS FOR DEBATE: – no Hitlering – ok soft Hitlering is ok just don't do the salute – no saying "mah wiiiiiefe" in a Borat voice — Erin Gloria Ryan (@morninggloria) September 26, 2016 the best debate prep for Hillary Clinton would be having her try to respond to every one of the eggs that @ her on twitter — Dana Schwartz (@DanaSchwartzzz) September 26, 2016 Twitter is also not expressing much confidence in NBC News’ Lester Holt, who is serving as the moderator. Twitter users predicted Holt would likely find himself underwater trying to keep the conversation civil. HILLARY: did he just say the moon is made of cheese? TRUMP: yes, a giant cheesy space moon MODERATOR: let's move on — Nice Eric (@ericsshadow) September 26, 2016 Preview of Lester Holt trying to moderate the Presidential Debate at Hofstra tonight #debatenight pic.twitter.com/OpDr0cYzdI — Nat Baimel (@NatBaimel) September 26, 2016 Others have simply tweeted their prediction for how tonight’s debate will go based on both the media hype surrounding the event and each candidate’s behavior. Prediction: Trump is civil to Hillary during tomorrow's debate but squeezes out silent farts the entire time. — Michael Ian Black (@michaelianblack) September 25, 2016 Sneak preview of tomorrow night's presidential debate: pic.twitter.com/63EzUa0SmT — Anne T. Donahue (@annetdonahue) September 26, 2016 Kinda pumped for the Trump/Hillary debate tomorrow. Will be like UFC but bloodier — Gay Vibes (@jacksfilms) September 26, 2016 The debate will air live on CNN at 9 PM Eastern. The debate will be commercial-free, meaning each candidate will be on their feet for 90 consecutive minutes without a break. The topics are expected to include the economy, terrorism, and national security. Tonight’s event is expected to be one of the most-watched in television history, with an expected 100 million viewers.
article.title: 11 Tweets About Tonight’s Debate That’ll Make You Laugh, Then Cry
